text:
Hi all,
One of my users on Windows 10 Pro 22H2 accepted a pushed offer from Microsoft to
install Win 11 22H2. This is despite having selected "stay on Win 10" some time
in the past. They did NOT reboot the machine so it is waiting at the "pending
restart" message. I do NOT want this machine on Windows 11. I have paused
updates to the latest date offered while seeking a solution. Is there a
"simple" way to reverse this action and stay on Windows 10? By simple, I mean
not finishing the Win 11 install with a restart and then having to uninstall. 
Thanks for any tips you can offer. 
Ira Shapiro
Ira Shapiro Computer Consulting 
--
%3DcXV_ivAMz09FmUXTiD6hKOGtJWVcLEv4w%40mail.gmail.com

Windows 11 upgrade 
You don't often get email from ycats610@gmail.com. Learn why this is important
[https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Hi all,
One of my users on Windows 10 Pro 22H2 accepted a pushed offer from Microsoft to
install Win 11 22H2.  This is despite having selected "stay on Win 10" some time
in the past.  They did NOT reboot the machine so it is waiting at the "pending
restart" message.  I do NOT want this machine on Windows 11.  I have paused
updates to the latest date offered while seeking a solution.  Is there a
"simple" way to reverse this action and stay on Windows 10?  By simple, I mean
not finishing the Win 11 install with a restart and then having to uninstall. 
Thanks for any tips you can offer. 
Ira Shapiro
